DataElement.preferredName: EORTC Quality of Life Questionnaire-Core 30 Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating whether or not the EORTC-C30 Quality of Life questionnaire was administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: EORTC Quality of Life Questionnaire-Core 30 Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An integrated system for assessing the quality of life of cancer patients participating in clinical trials and other types of research. It incorporates five functional scales: Physical, Role, Cognitive, Emotional, and Social Functioning; three symptom scales: Fatigue, Pain, and Nausea/Vomiting; a Global Health Status/QoL scale; and six single item scales: Dyspnea, Insomnia, Appetite Loss, Constipation, Diarrhea, and Financial Difficulties._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An integrated system for assessing the quality of life of cancer patients participating in clinical trials and other types of research. It incorporates five functional scales: Physical, Role, Cognitive, Emotional, and Social Functioning; three symptom scales: Fatigue, Pain, and Nausea/Vomiting; a Global Health Status/QoL scale; and six single item scales: Dyspnea, Insomnia, Appetite Loss, Constipation, Diarrhea, and Financial Difficulties.

Concepts.definition: An integrated system for assessing the quality of life of cancer patients participating in clinical trials and other types of research. It incorporates five functional scales: Physical, Role, Cognitive, Emotional, and Social Functioning; three symptom scales: Fatigue, Pain, and Nausea/Vomiting; a Global Health Status/QoL scale; and six single item scales: Dyspnea, Insomnia, Appetite Loss, Constipation, Diarrhea, and Financial Difficulties.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
